simplified: Your dreams can show you things you think about, even if you do not know it. Some dreams are common, like flying or falling. You might dream your teeth fall out or you have no clothes on in public. These dreams mean similar things for most people. But to know what your dreams mean for you, think about your daily life and how you feel.

One interesting thing about animals in a city is the wild dogs in Moscow. There are about 35,000 wild dogs on the streets of Moscow. Some dogs were born wild, and some were pets that people left. Some dogs live alone, and some live in groups. In 2010, scientists studied the dogs. They found that the dogs are good at living in the city. They learned that crossing the street with people is safer. Some dogs even seem to know about traffic lights.

Wonder is a book by RJ Palacio. She saw a girl with a different face and thought of the book. Wonder is very popular and won awards. Schools use it to talk about bullying and friendship. A movie is coming soon. Many people want to read RJ Palacio's next book.

Chloe has two pet rats, Zena and Roxy. Chloe knows they are not normal pets. She has told many people that rats are not dirty. They can be good pets if you take care of them. But she knows why people don't like them. She didn't like rats before. Her friend Martin showed her his pet rats. She saw they were loving and smart. Last year, Martin's rat had babies. Chloe wanted to get two of them.

Baboons in Cape Town have problems. Some get hurt by cars or die. Others get hurt by electric wires. Baboons are special animals. There are not many of them left. To help them and stop fights with people, the city has "Baboon Monitors". They make baboons leave cities. Or they take them to the countryside. This has helped some. But it is hard to stop baboons from coming back to the city for food.

I work for a global IT company. Their main office is in America. I do all my work online from home. This means I do not travel to work. I also do not talk much with colleagues. I work on projects. This is good for me. I can take time off easily. This is useful when my children have school shows. It is also good when I need to see the dentist. The bad thing is that I work late. I sometimes miss dinner to finish work.

In the 1990s, spray paint on walls was still there. But street art also grew a lot everywhere. Some artists had ideas about politics. They made art to make people think about war. And they made art about people not being treated fairly. Other street artists just wanted to make pretty art. In South America, many street artists went to work in poor places. They added color, life, and beauty to grey city walls.

Social media, magazines, and shop windows show people many things to buy every day. People in Britain are buying more clothes and shoes than before. Online shopping makes it easy to buy things quickly. Big companies sell very cheap clothes. People can wear them two or three times and then throw them away.

Sam looked at the car far away. It made dust. The car went to the Big House. The horses moved their tails because of flies. They did not care about their owner. The owner had not been there for ten months. Sam waited. Mr Carter did not like to come here. Sam liked that. If Sam stayed away from his boss, he would keep his job. Mr Carter wiped sweat from his neck. His shirt was wet. His skin got red in the sun. He made money, and other people did the work.

Many people in Berlin, Germany, thought it was cruel to shoot pigs. There were big arguments between hunters and people who love animals. Because of this, the city council decided to try something more peaceful. They put up fences and made a rule that people cannot feed the pigs. We will see if this plan works. But it might be difficult because warm winters mean there are more pigs now.

The Hunger Games book was inspired by Suzanne Collins' love for old Greek stories. When she was little, she really liked the story of Theseus and the Minotaur. In this story, Athens was controlled by Crete. But the people of Athens fought back. So, the king of Crete, Minos, made them send seven boys and seven girls to Crete every year. These young people were put in a maze where a monster called the Minotaur ate them. But a young man named Theseus fought and killed the Minotaur. Suzanne thinks Katniss Everdeen is like a Theseus from the future.

Zoos can teach people about animals and nature. They help people want to save animals and their homes. Some zoos give a safe place for animals from circuses or pets left alone. Zoos also learn about how animals act and how to make them well.

A new idea is starting. It is against buying too much. This idea began in Canada in the 1990s and then went to the US. People did not want to buy many things on sale days. On "Buy Nothing Day," people protest. They cut their credit cards. Throughout the year, "Buy Nothing" groups help people trade and fix things they already own.

Is graffiti art or vandalism? Many people have different ideas. In many countries, painting on buildings is wrong. Police have stopped many street artists. Some had to pay money. City leaders say it costs a lot to clean graffiti from buildings, buses, and trains.

Many people now think graffiti and street art are real art. There have been big shows of street art in art places like Paris, London, and Los Angeles. A US artist named Elura Emerald had a street art show in New York in 2008. She said street artists are just showing their feelings and not hurting anyone. She thinks we should like and praise them.

Most people dream four to six times each night after they are ten years old. This means they can have up to 2,000 dreams every year. So, by the time they are 80, a person might have dreamed 140,000 times. We forget almost all our dreams, but we still remember a few thousand over our lives. It is easy to think that sometimes a dream can be like something that happens in real life by chance, especially if it is about something common.

The Hunger Games is set in the future, after North America was destroyed. The country is called Panem. It has twelve poor areas ruled by a rich big city called the Capitol. The Capitol controls everything. Each area makes different things for the Capitol. The story starts in Area 12. This area gets all the coal for the country. There used to be an Area 13, but they fought against the Capitol and were destroyed.

Wild animals often go into cities to find food. In Cape Town, South Africa, baboons now go into homes near the city for food. They open trash cans and eat fruit from gardens. Some baboons even go into houses and take food from kitchens! Baboons can be mean and have hurt many pets. So, it is clear that many people in the city do not like them there being around them.
Many bridges can fall down when people build them. Sometimes, engineers make mistakes, like wrong math. The bridge is too heavy and falls. This can hurt or kill workers who are there.

George Lucas was a film director. He based his story on the hero's journey. A hero usually starts with a normal life. Then, something happens that makes them go on an adventure. This changes everything. In Star Wars, Luke lives a normal life with his aunt and uncle. He fixes robots. He finds a message from Princess Leia in the robot R2D2. This message tells him to go on an adventure. This is how his journey as a hero begins.

One way to stop a space rock from hitting Earth is to use a nuclear bomb. This might seem like a movie. But NASA has a real plan called HAMMER. They want to send rockets to push the space rock away. If it is too close, the rockets will carry nuclear bombs to blow it up.

A hero does not want to go on an adventure at first. Then, a helper comes. The hero decides to go to a special new world. In this world, the hero does tests, fights bad people, and meets friends. This helps the hero get ready for a big fight. For example, Luke’s helper is Obi-Wan. His friends are Han Solo, R2D2, and C3PO. Darth Vader is the bad person in the Death Star.

Things we don't use much can seem useless to some. But other people can use them. The internet has helped groups online find a way to make money by sharing these things. Websites and social media groups help people buy and sell old things easily. It is now simple for people to share with each other. This is called the sharing economy.

In the 1700s and 1800s, people had two main ideas about dreams. One idea was that dreams show us special thoughts. Freud thought dreams could help us learn about our secret feelings. The other idea was different. It said dreams are just random things our brain does when we sleep. Our brain sorts memories from the day. When we wake up, we try to understand these random pictures and feelings, and we make a story.

I work for myself. I like this because I control my work and time. I first worked at home, but it was hard to focus there. Many things bothered me, like housework, tea, and family asking for things. So I went to a cafe. But the internet was bad, and I drank too much coffee. Then, I rented a desk in an office with five other people. I liked getting dressed for work and focusing in an office.

NASA needs money to build a special telescope called NEOCam. This telescope will find space rocks using heat. If they get the money, they can find most of these rocks in ten years. After finding them, scientists need to learn how to stop the big, dangerous rocks from hitting Earth.

The "buy nothing" idea is now with people on social media who show clothes and makeup. Some YouTube stars tell people not to buy things for a year. Two friends in Canada bought only food for one year. First, for three months, they lived without buying electric things, clothes, or house things. Then, they stopped using services, like haircuts, eating in restaurants, or buying gas for cars. They saved $55,000 in one year.

Pi cares about religion. His family is Hindu, but he likes to learn about other religions too. He becomes friends with a Christian priest and a Muslim baker. Pi surprises everyone by saying he is Hindu, Muslim, and Christian all at once. His family and teachers want him to pick only one religion, but Pi says no. He says, "I just want to love God." After that, his family and teachers let him choose his own religion.

Some people think writing down dreams can help you have lucid dreams. Lucid dreams are dreams where you know you are dreaming. In these dreams, you can choose what happens. So, you can change a bad dream into a good dream. Or you can decide what happens in your dream, like a movie maker. Then, you are not just finding out what your dreams mean. You are making them. But you might still want some dreams where your mind tells you what it is thinking!

Many people do not know they cause a problem with clothes because they give old clothes to shops that help people. But these shops cannot sell all the clothes. New clothes styles change fast, and the clothes are often not good enough to use again. People do not want to buy them used. Lots of clothes are thrown away. Also, many clothes that shops cannot sell go to other countries. This makes more problems for money and the world.

Meagan McGrath from Canada likes adventures. She climbed the highest mountain on every continent. She rode a bike across Canada. She ran a long race in the hot Sahara Desert. But her most special trip was skiing to the South Pole. On the first day, she fell into ice and someone saved her. Many people would stop then. But Meagan kept going. She got to the South Pole in forty days. She pulled a sled with her tent and food. It was very cold, and there were ice storms.
Blek le Rat painted rats in Paris. Now, he wants people to think about problems. He paints homeless people in cities. He wants people to think about how to help people without homes.

In some places, like cities, they let artists paint on special walls. They do not want them to paint everywhere. Taiwan has these special places for painting. Artists can paint freely there. In a city called São Paulo in Brazil, artists can even paint on subway trains.

Faith47 is an artist from Cape Town, South Africa. She makes large, colorful paintings of people and animals. She likes to paint in many different places, like on sidewalks, in empty buildings, and on old cars. Faith47 knows that most street art does not last forever. The weather or city workers will soon remove it. She thinks this is like life, which always changes with new starts and endings.

Gabriela worked in a place where bosses had a lot of power. People listened to leaders. Leaders made big choices. Her team in Sweden worked with their bosses. Leaders helped them think, and they could ask questions.

Gabriela and her team had different cultures. She talked to them about her leading. The team liked that she asked. They said they didn't like being told what to do. They liked to have their own ideas. When she told them exactly what to do, they felt she didn't trust them. They knew Gabriela felt bad when they didn't agree with her. They said they always worked this way.

Os Gêmeos are twin brothers from São Paulo. They paint big, colorful pictures of people on buildings. Their art is often so big they need cranes to help. In 2007, they painted a whole castle in Scotland.

People have painted and written on walls for a very long time. In old times, people in Africa and Europe drew animals and people in caves. We found old writings on buildings in Greece, Italy, Syria, and Iraq. In the Roman town of Pompeii, people found many examples of writings in Latin. These writings had religious, political, and love messages, and even some magic words!

Have you ever wanted to climb big mountains or walk to very cold places? Many people feel this way. Every year, many people try to climb the world's tallest mountains or walk across big land areas. Long ago, explorers used maps and compasses. Now, adventurers use new tools like GPS and special phones. Many adventurers love nature. They travel to help people learn about problems with the environment. Others want to help people who need it and collect money for good causes.

The first test is DART. It will hit a moon of an asteroid called Didymos. This moon, called 'Didymoon', is 150 meters wide. It goes around its bigger asteroid. The bigger asteroid is 800 meters wide. We hope that when DART hits Didymoon, it will move a little. Then, people on Earth can see this change with telescopes.

Katniss Everdeen is a 16-year-old girl. Her father died in a mining accident. She needs to find food for her family. She hunts in the forest near District 12 with her friend, Gale. She is very good with a bow and arrow. Her younger sister, Prim, is chosen for a dangerous game. Katniss decides to go instead of Prim. Peeta, a boy from District 12, also goes to the game. Katniss and Peeta have a difficult relationship.

If you write about your dreams, you will start to remember more details. Think about the people and places in your dream. They might have a special meaning. After one week, you will be surprised how much you have written. Then you can link your dreams to what happens and how you feel in your daily life.
Many old bridges were made of wood. They often burned easily. This was true for old train bridges. Sparks from the train could make the bridge burn.

We cannot know how street art will change in the future, but some new things are happening. Many street artists are young and paint in their city. But now, more street artists travel to paint in different cities around the world. Other artists use the internet to talk and share pictures of their art. Also, important art people are starting to see street art as real art. We don't know what will happen, but street art will stay!

Suzanne Collines never liked war news. Her father was a pilot in the US Air Force. He fought in Vietnam. Her mother tried to hide the war from her. But Suzanne saw war news and knew her dad was in Vietnam. It made her very scared.

PwC asked many young (born 1983-1993) and older people about their jobs. They asked about how people work, talk, pay, and life balance. Deloitte also asked many young people about good and bad things at work.

Erik Weihenmayer is from the USA. He does many adventures. He rode a bike in the hot desert of Morocco. He went kayaking in the Grand Canyon. He also climbed Mount Everest. Erik became blind when he was 13 years old. This is amazing! Besides his trips, he helps people with disabilities. He tells them to live active lives. He also takes young blind people on climbing trips.

Online shops are making it easy for people to earn money. For example, some parents are very busy, so they did not sell their children's old things at a market. But now, they can sell baby clothes that are too small for their children on online shops. They can also sell expensive baby strollers. This helps them get some money back.

Pi and Richard Parker are in a lifeboat for 227 days. They are hungry, sick, and tired. Storms are strong, and the sun is hot. But they live through it. Sometimes, Pi feels good with his religions. Other times, he is sad and alone. Then, they see Mexico. Everything changes. Read the book to know what happens to Pi and Richard Parker when they see land.

Chloe got home from school. She made coffee and took it to her room. She had homework, but she waited. She liked the quiet time before her parents came home. Then the house would be noisy with talking, TV, or her dad's jazz music while he cooked. She also liked this time because she could play with her pet rats.

In 2010, NASA found most big rocks in space close to Earth. These rocks are 1 kilometer wide. They are called NEOs. They are within 50 million kilometers of Earth. NASA thinks they still need to find 50 more. But NASA says the 887 NEOs they know about will not hurt Earth.

Auggie decides to go to school. His first day is hard. He is very worried, like other children at a new school. But he looks different, so it is very hard for him. No one wants to sit by him. He sees kids looking at him or talking about him. But he becomes friends with Jack and Summer. Jack is in his class. Summer talks to him at lunch. The first day is not the only hard day. Auggie learns his classmates do not want to touch him. They are scared of getting "the plague." As the school year goes, Auggie has many good and bad times. Then, something bad happens at a school camp. It changes everything.

The two men looked north. The land was very big. They could barely see the fences. A teenage boy could not run away on foot. Sam looked at a big horse. It was kicking the ground. He wondered, "Can the boy ride a horse?" A good rider could find trouble far away from people. But someone who cannot ride a horse and wants to leave his father might find more trouble.

More than 4,000 climbers have reached the top of Mount Everest. They were aged from 13 to 80 years old. Climbing high mountains in cold and stormy weather is still very risky. But the best climbers in the world are now looking for new challenges. Gerlinde Kaltenbrunner from Austria loved climbing mountains when she was young. After school, she worked as a nurse. But she still climbed in her free time.

Gerlinde climbed Everest. Now she wants to climb 14 mountains that are 8,000 meters high. She climbs without oxygen tanks. This is dangerous because low oxygen can hurt her brain and body. Gerlinde helps poor children and orphans in Nepal with her fame from climbing.
Many things we buy are not used well. For example, a warm coat in a hot country, an old phone, a car used only on weekends, or a guest room used for storage.
Dreams have always been important. People thought dreams were messages from gods. They thought dreams told us things. Many people still remember dreaming about something, and then it happened.
Building big bridges costs a lot. Bridges help cars and trains go over water or mountains. So, bridges are very important in building. People check them carefully, especially if they fall down.

Gabriela was upset for many weeks. She wrote to her boss in Sweden about her team's problems. Her boss asked if her team was still doing good work. He also asked what she thought would help her work better with her team. Gabriela felt her boss was not clear and was not doing enough to help.

Dogs in groups learned that people often give food to smaller, cuter dogs. So, these dogs go to ask for food for all the other dogs. Some dogs even learned to use the city trains to go to different places they know. Scientists don't know how the dogs know when to get off the train. One idea is that their good sense of smell helps them find places they like. Another idea is that they hear station names and learn them. People on the train are used to seeing dogs, so they do not often notice them.

Ed Stafford from the UK was the first person to walk along the Amazon River. He started from a small stream in the Andes mountains in Peru. He arrived at the river's end in Brazil after two years and four months. He walked 6,000 kilometres. The Amazon jungle has dangerous snakes, crocodiles, and jaguars, so Ed was always in danger. Luckily, he was okay with only many mosquito and ant bites.

In Britain, people spend over £1,000 on new clothes each year. This is about four percent of their money. This might not seem like a lot. But it shows two bad things for people and for nature. First, people often buy clothes with credit cards. British adults owe about £670 to credit card companies. This is 66 percent of what they spend on clothes. Also, people are using money they don't have to buy things they don't need. Britain throws away 300,000 tons of clothes every year. Most of these clothes go into big holes in the ground.

Ed could not walk without machines. He used a radio to ask people in the rainforest for food and to cross their land. Many people met him and helped him through the hard places. Ed wrote a blog every day about his trip. He used the news about his trip to talk about the rainforest being cut down. He also got money for groups that help nature and children in Brazil and Peru.

Businesses now see that sharing things can make money. They want to use things that are not used a lot. A popular business idea is to have a website or app. This website or app helps customers find people who can give them a product or a service. For example, Airbnb helps people rent out their extra rooms or houses. They can earn money from this. Another example is Uber. Uber lets people use their own cars as taxis. This helps them earn extra money when they have free time.

Zoos help animals. They help animals that are in danger. Some animals in nature cannot find partners. They are also in danger from hunters or losing their homes. Zoos let these animals live safely and have babies. When there are fewer wild animals, their families can become too alike. Breeding programs help. Animals born in zoos can go back to nature. This makes their families stronger.

Accidents where boats or trains make a bridge fall are very rare. But they can happen. A train can make a bridge fall if it hits it very fast. A boat can make a bridge fall if it is very big and heavy, even if it moves slowly. To stop bridges from falling, we need to plan. We can use new tools to find weak spots. Also, safer places to work and better designs can help stop these bad accidents.

At first, Pi is scared of the animals and jumps into the water. But then he remembers that there are hungry sharks in the water. So, he knows he must go back to the boat. The animals on the boat fight and eat each other. Soon, only Pi and the tiger are left. Luckily for Pi, the tiger is sick from the waves and does not want to eat him right away. Pi calls the tiger Richard Parker.

When Pi is 16, a new government is chosen. Pi's parents are worried. They decide to close their zoo and move to Canada. They sell some animals to zoos in North America. The family travels to Canada on a ship with the other animals. A big storm happens, and the ship sinks. Pi's family and the sailors all die. But Pi is in a lifeboat with a hyena, a zebra, an orangutan, and a very big tiger.

The Hunger Games is a very popular book for teens. Suzanne Collins, an American writer, wrote it. It came out in 2008. Many people around the world have bought it. It is in 26 languages. It was also the first book for young people to sell over one million e-books. Now, The Hunger Games is also a big movie from Hollywood. It is also very popular. It made 152.5 million dollars in its first weekend in North America.

Dreams might be our brain sorting thoughts from the day. But in dreams, thoughts show as symbols. When we are awake, we think with words, like talking to ourselves. When we sleep, the part of our brain for words slows down. The part for feelings wakes up.

Having good friends and family makes you happy. Happy people often spend time with their friends and family. You also need someone to talk to about your feelings. One person is enough for this. It is good to have other friends too. But you need to talk about important things with at least one person. This helps make strong relationships. Sometimes, people need to learn to listen better to others.

Carol Dweck, a mind expert, says our brains can change. We can learn new things and get good at skills, even if we were not good at them before. We often tell people they are good at something right away, like "You are good at finding small things" or "You are good at planning parties." But studies show that it is better to praise how people try. If we praise effort and trying new ways to solve problems, people will learn new skills and get better.

The robot often checks the air. In 2014, it found methane in the air. Methane is a basic organic molecule and a part of natural gas. Methane only lasts for a few hundred years. This means something on Mars is making more methane. NASA says Mars releases a lot of methane. The amount of methane changes with the seasons, like the planet is breathing.

Carol Dweck, a psychologist, gave difficult puzzles to 10-year-olds. Some children liked the challenge. They believed they could improve. This is called a "growth mindset." Other children felt bad. They thought their intelligence was being judged. They had a "fixed mindset" and did not think they could get better.

Horror movies often use empty places. These can be old hospitals, empty houses, or towns with no people. Lonely places are interesting. What happened when people lived there? Why did they go away? Maybe these places are scary because they are quiet. Also, it is easy for horror movies to show bad phone service in abandoned places.

Basements are scary in horror movies. Something is often hiding there, or a bad person keeps tools there. Basements are always dark and often wet. You can only go down a small stairs to reach them. And basements are always spooky, even when nothing is there.

Gary Collins, a policeman not working, was watching the London riots on TV. He knew some people right away. He stopped his holiday to help find them. He watched many videos for six months. He found 190 people, many just by looking at their eyes. His help was very important. A computer program looked at 200,000 hours of videos, but it only found one person.

I think it is interesting to think about how we will make our bodies better. Imagine if you could put a computer in our brain! Soon we can do that and make our math skills, seeing, and hearing better. This idea will be very normal.

The talk was very interesting. The speaker said some true things. For example, parents use their phones a lot. They post on social media when they cook or drive. So, teenagers also use their phones when they do homework. The speaker also said that people want to be in many places at once. They switch between talking in real life and talking online. I see this with my daughter and her friends. They meet, but then they sit quietly and talk to different people online.

News makes it seem like the world is becoming more dangerous. But we can also be positive. After World War II until 1990, 30 wars killed more than 100,000 people. Now, there are still civil wars, but countries are mostly living together more calmly than before. Yet, terrorism has gone up in the past few years. And since World War II, wars have killed more ordinary people than soldiers. But even for ordinary people, the numbers are not all bad. It is much more likely to die from a violent crime than from a fight between groups. But the number of murders in the world slowly went down. It was 8 for every 100,000 people in 2000, and about 5.3 in 2015.

Wasfia helps people. She saw many projects in her country to teach women and girls. But when these projects ended, the women and girls had nothing. Wasfia wanted Bangladesh to be strong. So she used her love for climbing mountains and helping people. She wanted to change how people think about women in her country. She started climbing when she worked in Tibet and Nepal. Most people in Bangladesh have never seen a mountain because it is a flat country near the sea. Her work is helping. People in her country and around the world are noticing.

Most people think poor countries are in a bad way. They believe these countries have great poverty, bad leaders, and little hope for change. But this is not true. Things are getting much better. In the last 20 years, over 700 million people earned more money and are not poor anymore. Also, 6 million fewer children die from sickness each year. Many more girls go to school, and many people can get clean water.

Bosses often give some good and some bad comments. But if this happens a lot, workers might think the good comments are just to make the bad comments easier. Good comments should truly help workers do better, not just hide bad things.

I am part of a group that wants to stop killer robots. Do not think about scary robots from movies. Think about what is happening now: army machines like drones and robot guns kill people with little human help. Soon, robots may kill by themselves. They will follow orders, but finally, they will decide who to kill. I think this is very bad and unsafe for people. We need to be very careful with what we let machines do.

Many more people learn English than all other languages together. Also, people speak English in the most countries. But Chinese has the most native speakers. The number of native speakers and the number of learners do not seem to be connected. But there is a stronger link between the number of learners and how many countries speak the language.

Your manager talks to you about your work on the new project. You are scared all weekend. You wonder what you did wrong. On Monday, she says you did good work. You think she will say bad things after. You know about the "feedback sandwich." First, say something good. Then, say something bad. Then, say something good again.

Born in the USA is a rock album with fast music. But it has important words. The songs have nice music, but they also tell sad stories about the American dream. Many songs are about normal people who work hard. They feel sad and angry because they don't get rich or famous. For example, "Glory Days" is about people in a small town remembering when they were young and everything was good. "Downbound Train" is about a young man whose life is bad after he loses his job. You can imagine the singer is writing about real people he knew. This album shows the singer is very talented.

Lewis wants more parts of the sea to be safe. He wants to increase these safe areas from 3% to 10%. This will help stop harm from fishing, dirt, and trash. Lewis saw bad things in the ocean. He saw white coral because the water got too hot. He also saw parts of the Red Sea that had no life and lots of plastic. Pugh thinks nature can get better if we give it time. But we must hurry. If we do not care for our seas, we will have a big problem.

Terrie Sharp is a famous writer. She writes good stories. She won the Olive Crime Writer Award two times. She was born in Glasgow, in a place with a lot of crime. She learned to be quiet and stay safe. She also learned how to open car doors with a knife. But she only used this for her books. Now she talks a lot. She is on TV shows like Police Today. She also goes to writing events in the UK.

Are things getting worse every day? In a book called "Enlightenment Now," Steven Pinker says that people are living longer, healthier, and happier. But he also says that people are not always using good ideas from the past. When people listen to bad leaders, it can hurt important things like fair rules and helping each other.

In old scary movies, people needing help could not easily call for it or the police. Now, mobile phones make this harder to believe. So, what can we do to keep it scary? No phone signal! If you are the hero in a scary movie, it is very likely that you will have no phone signal when you need to call for help. Or your phone battery will die when you are talking. Maybe both will happen.

In the 1950s, banana farms in Central America had a big problem. Their best banana, the Gros Michel, was dying. This banana was also called Big Mike. Now, the same thing is happening again to the Cavendish banana, which took Big Mike's place. The Gros Michel banana was easy to move, had a thick skin, and tasted sweet. It was grown a lot on farms in Central America. United Fruit was a big company that grew and sold bananas in South America. They grew many bananas very well. They made new plants from parts of old plants, not from seeds. They grew many plants close together in fields.

Most spiders have venom. They use it to catch food, not to hurt people. Only 25 kinds of spiders have venom that can hurt people. Spider bites can hurt, but they rarely kill. For example, the Sydney funnel-web spider in Australia has not killed anyone since 1981, when medicine was made for its bite. But be careful with hairy spiders like tarantulas. When they are scared, they shoot out tiny hairs. These hairs can get stuck in your skin or eyes and make you itch.

This scary movie idea was common in scary movies from the late 1900s. It starts with a group of teens having fun. It ends with everyone dead except one girl. At first, the girl is shy and not strong. But by the end, she is the strongest and smartest person. The last girl almost always wins.

We want to know about our language ability. We need to look at how our brains are different from animal brains. It is not just about brain size. It is important what our brains can do. It is also important when and why they changed. We do not have many clues about this. Things from our old family do not tell us what they said. But we can see how the mouth, throat, and tongue of early people grew. About 100,000 years ago, people could make hard sounds. Before that, scientists can only guess if early people used simple sounds to talk.

Society, not nature, tells girls to like arts and humanities, and boys to like math and physics. Also, young girls don't see many women doing science jobs. Cartoons often show men as smart scientists or astronauts. Some people think scientists are strange, don't talk much, or work alone. This is wrong, but it might make girls not want to be scientists. If girls saw more good examples of women in science, they would feel better and want to join these subjects.

The Scallion newspaper comes out every week. It is free. You can find it in school buildings. About 10,000 students read it. Students write and make the newspaper. A survey shows that students and teachers like the newspaper a lot. They like it for fun, to learn about culture, and for work experience. Printing the newspapers costs a lot of money. Also, some students cannot easily get the paper. They have to go to the university to get a copy. Another problem is that many copies become trash on campus.

At Girox Foods, many workers leave each year. About 12 out of 100 workers leave. This seems okay, but most other companies only have 7 out of 100 workers leave. This report will look at why workers are happy or not happy at our company. Then, it will give ideas to make workers like their jobs more and stay longer.

Many things the speaker said were true. I think that if we are connected too much, we may feel alone. This is not a big problem for older people like me. We lived a long time without much technology. We know how to be alone, and that is okay. But for young people, it is different. They text a lot and are never really alone. They might not learn to enjoy their own time. Also, they learn to talk by writing messages they can change. So, they do not learn to talk face-to-face right away with someone.
Do not always add bad comments after good ones. If you always give good and bad comments together, the good ones might not seem important. Sometimes, only give good comments and do not give bad ones.

Your dreams can show you things you did not know you were thinking about. Common dreams, like flying or falling, or your teeth falling out, or being naked in public, probably mean the same thing for most people. But to understand what your dreams mean to you, you need to connect them to what happens in your daily life and how you feel.

One of the most interesting examples of wild animals living in a city are the wild dogs in Moscow. About 35,000 wild dogs live on the streets of Moscow. Some of these dogs were born wild, while others were pets that their owners left. Some dogs live by themselves, and others live in groups. In 2010, scientists studied the dogs and found that they have learned to live very well in the city. They have learned that it is safer to cross the street with people, and some dogs seem to understand traffic lights.

Wonder is the first novel by New Yorker RJ Palacio. She says she got the idea for the book after seeing a girl with facial differences. Wonder has been a top-selling book in the United States and has won several awards. Many schools are using it to talk about bullying, friendship, and what it's like to be different. A movie is being made about it, and many people, including me, are excited to see what RJ Palacio writes next.

Chloe has two pet rats, Zena and Roxy. Chloe knows they are not typical pets. She has regularly explained to people that rats are not dirty and make excellent pets if cared for properly. But she understands why people react negatively. She herself did not like rats until her friend Martin showed her his pet rats. She then saw how affectionate and intelligent they were. Last year, when one of Martin's rats had babies, Chloe decided she would like to have two of them.

Cape Town is a dangerous place for baboons. Cars hit some baboons, and they die. Other baboons touch electric wires and get hurt. Baboons are special animals, and there are not many left. To help baboons and keep them safe from people, the city has workers called Baboon Monitors. These workers scare baboons away from the city or catch them and let them go in the countryside. This plan has worked a little, but it is hard to stop baboons from coming back to the city because they find food easily there.

I work for a global IT company. Their main office is in the United States, so I work from home online. This means I don't spend time traveling to work or talking much with co-workers. I work on projects, and this is good for me because I can take time off easily when my children have school plays or when I need to see the dentist. The problem is that I work late into the evening, sometimes missing dinner, because I don't have set office hours.

In the 1990s, graffiti continued, but street art also became very popular worldwide. Some artists made political art about war, inequality, and discrimination to make people think. Other street artists focused on creating beautiful work. In South America, many street artists worked in poor areas, making grey city walls colorful, lively, and beautiful.

Every day, social media, magazines, and shops show people many things to buy. People in Britain are buying more clothes and shoes than before. Buying things online is easy, so people buy without thinking. Also, big brands sell very cheap clothes. People wear them only a few times and then throw them away, like they are disposable.

Sam looked at the dust made by the car going to the Big House. The horses were annoyed by flies. They did not care that their owner, Mr. Carter, was visiting for the first time in ten months. Sam waited. Mr. Carter did not like to come to this place, and Sam was happy about that. Sam knew that if he stayed away from his boss, he would keep his job longer. Mr. Carter wiped sweat from his neck. His shirt was wet. His skin was already red from the sun in June. He looked like a man who worked inside while others worked outside.

Many people in Berlin, Germany, were unhappy because they thought shooting pigs was very cruel. Hunters and people who love animals argued a lot about this. Because of these protests, the city council decided to try something else against the pigs that was more peaceful. They stopped shooting them. Now, they have put up fences and made a rule that people cannot feed the pigs. We will see if this plan works. However, it might be hard because warmer winters mean there are more pigs than before.

The Hunger Games books were inspired by Suzanne Collins' love for old Greek stories. When she was a child, she really liked the story of Theseus and the Minotaur. In this story, Athens was controlled by Crete, but the people of Athens fought back. As a punishment, King Minos of Crete made Athens send seven boys and seven girls to Crete every year. These young people were put into a maze and eaten by a monster called the Minotaur. But a young man named Theseus fought and killed the Minotaur. Suzanne Collins thinks Katniss Everdeen is like a modern Theseus.

Zoos help people learn about animals and their homes, and they encourage people to protect them. Some zoos offer a safe place for animals that were treated badly, such as those from circuses or abandoned pets. Zoos also conduct important research on animal behavior and how to treat illnesses.

There's a new idea against buying too much: the 'buy nothing' idea. It started in Canada in the 1990s and then came to the US. There, it was a way to say no to spending and buying too much on Black Friday and Cyber Monday, which are big shopping days after Thanksgiving. On Buy Nothing Day, people protest in different ways and cut up their credit cards. All year, 'Buy Nothing' groups help people exchange and fix things they already have.

Is graffiti art or a crime? It depends on what you think, but in many places, writing on public or private buildings is seen as a crime. Many street artists have been caught by the police, and some have had to pay money. Many city councils say it costs a lot to clean graffiti from buildings and transport.

What does the art world think about graffiti and street art? More and more, people see it as real art. Big shows of street art have happened in galleries in Paris, London, and Los Angeles. In 2008, American artist Elura Emerald had a street art show in a New York gallery. She said street artists are just showing their feelings and not hurting anyone. She thought they should be liked and praised.

Most people dream four to six times every night after the age of ten, making it about 2,000 dreams per year. So, by the time they reach 80 years old, the average person could have had 140,000 dreams. Even if we forget most of our dreams (95–99%), we still might remember a few thousand over our lifetime. It is not too hard to believe that, by chance, something from a dream might happen in real life that is similar to it, especially if the dream is about something common in everyday life.

The Hunger Games happens in the future, after North America was ruined. The land is called Panem. It has twelve poor areas called districts and a rich main city called the Capitol. The Capitol has all the power over the country. Each district makes different things for the Capitol. District 12, where the story starts, gives all the coal for the country. There used to be a thirteenth district, but it fought against the Capitol in the past and was destroyed.

Wild animals sometimes enter cities to find food. In Cape Town, South Africa, baboons have started entering residential areas on the city's edge to eat. They open rubbish bins and eat fruit from gardens. Some baboons have even entered people's houses and taken food from kitchens! Baboons can be aggressive and have attacked many pets, so many city residents are not happy about them.

Many bridge accidents happen when they are built. These accidents are often because engineers make mistakes, for example, they calculate something wrong. The bridge falls down because it is too heavy, and this can be very bad for the workers.

George Lucas was one of the first film directors to use the idea of the "hero's journey" in his movies. This journey has 17 steps. Usually, the hero lives a normal life at the start. Then, something happens that makes them go on an adventure that changes everything. In Star Wars, Luke lives a normal life with his aunt and uncle, fixing robots. He finds a message from Princess Leia to Obi-Wan Kenobi inside a robot called R2D2. This message is like "the call to adventure" that starts him on his journey.

One idea to stop a dangerous space rock coming to Earth is to use a nuclear bomb. This might sound like a movie, and it was in the 1998 film Armageddon. But NASA has a real plan called HAMMER. Large rockets would hit the space rock to push it away. If the space rock is too close, the rockets would carry nuclear bombs to blow it up.

Luke first says no to the adventure. But then a wise old man helps him, and Luke decides to go into a special world. In this world, he faces challenges, fights bad guys, and meets friends as friend. He gets ready to face his biggest challenge. Obi-Wan is Luke's helper. Han Solo and the robots R2D2 and C3PO are his friends. Darth Vader is his enemy. This all happens in the Death Star.

Some people might think old things are useless. But other people can use them. Now, with the internet, people can make money by sharing things they do not use much. Websites and social media groups help people buy and sell used things easily. This is called the sharing economy.

In the 18th and 19th centuries, two main ideas about dreams became popular. One idea was that dreams show us things our conscious mind hides. Freud thought that if we understand dreams, we can understand our hidden feelings and problems. The other idea was different. It said that dreams are just random brain activity when the brain organizes memories and events from the day. When we wake up, we try to understand these random images and feelings and make them into a story.

I work for myself, I am a freelancer. This is good because I decide what I do and how I use my time. First, I worked from home, but it was hard to focus. There were many things to distract me: house chores, more tea, and my family asking for my attention. So I went to a coffee shop to work, but the internet was not good, and I drank too much coffee. Finally, I decided to rent a desk in an office with five other freelancers. I liked getting ready for work in the morning and being able to concentrate in an office.

NASA needs money to build a telescope called NEOCam. This telescope will help them find medium-sized rocks in space using a special light. If they get the money, they can find these rocks in ten years. After finding them, a team will need to figure out how to stop the dangerous rocks from hitting Earth.

More and more, people who show clothes and make-up on social media are telling their followers not to buy things. Some people on YouTube are even telling their viewers not to buy anything for a whole year. Two friends in Canada decided to buy only food for a year. For the first three months, they learned to live without buying electronics, clothes, or things for their home. Then, they stopped paying for services like haircuts, eating at restaurants, or gas for their cars. In one year, they saved $55,000.

Pi thinks religion is important. His family is Hindu, but he is interested in other religions. He makes friends with a Christian priest and a Muslim baker. Pi surprises everyone by saying he is Hindu, Muslim, and Christian. When his family and teachers ask him to choose only one religion, Pi says no. He says, "I just want to love God." After that, his family and teachers let him make his own decisions about religion.

Some people think writing down dreams can help you have clear dreams. Clear dreams are when you know you are dreaming and can choose what happens. So, you can change a bad dream into a good one, or you can guide your dream like a movie director. Instead of just finding out what your dreams mean, you will be making them. But you might still want to have some dreams where your subconscious mind tells you what it is thinking.

People may not know they help create the disposable clothing problem. This is because they give their unwanted clothes to charity. But charity shops cannot sell all these clothes. 'Fast fashion' quickly becomes old-fashioned. It is often too low in quality to recycle. People do not want to buy it used. A lot of clothes are thrown away. Many clothes that charities cannot sell are sent to other countries. This causes more money and environmental problems.

Some adventurers don't stop at one amazing trip. They go from one challenge to another. Meagan McGrath from Canada has climbed the tallest mountain on every continent. She has also ridden her bike across Canada and run a long race in the Sahara Desert when it was 45 degrees Celsius. But her most amazing trip was skiing to the South Pole. On the first day, she fell into a crack in the ice and someone had to help her. Many people would have stopped then, but Meagan kept going. She reached the South Pole forty days later. She pulled a sled with her tent and all her food in it through very cold weather and ice storms.
Blek le Rat started painting rats in Paris. Now, he wants people to think about social issues. He paints homeless people in cities so residents think about homelessness.

In some places, city leaders have let artists paint graffiti in special areas. Taiwan is one of these places. It has "graffiti zones" where artists can freely paint on walls. In São Paulo, Brazil, the city even let some graffiti artists paint on their subway trains.

Faith47 is from Cape Town in South Africa. She paints large, colorful pictures of people and animals and likes to find different places to paint. You can see her art on pavements, in empty factories, and on abandoned cars. She likes that most street art is temporary and will soon be removed by weather or cleaners from the city council. For Faith47, this shows how life is full of change, with things ending and new things beginning.

In her old job, Gabriela was used to a place where bosses had a lot of power and people respected them. Everyone knew their place. In that kind of place, bosses made all the big choices, and no one usually questioned them. But her team in Sweden was used to a different way of working. There, people who worked for bosses often worked with them to find answers and make choices. In Sweden, bosses act more like helpers who want people to think for themselves and to ask questions.

When Gabriela realized the cultural differences with her team, she decided to talk to them. She asked them how they felt about her leadership. Her team was happy to share their thoughts. They told Gabriela they did not like being told exactly what to do. They preferred to have more freedom to take initiative and be creative. When Gabriela gave them exact instructions, they felt she did not trust them to do their job well. They also realized that Gabriela took it personally when they challenged her decisions or suggested changes. They explained that this was just how they always worked.

Os Gêmeos are twin brothers from São Paulo. They paint many things, from small drawings to big, colorful pictures of people on buildings. Their works are often so enormous that they need cranes to help them with the work. In 2007, they painted an entire castle in Scotland.

People have painted and written on walls for a long time. In ancient times, people in Africa and Europe drew animals and people in caves. Graffiti has been seen on old buildings in Greece, Italy, Syria, and Iraq. In the Roman town of Pompeii, experts found many examples of graffiti in Latin. These include messages about religion, politics, love, and even some magic.

Have you ever thought about climbing Mount Everest or going to the South Pole? Many people have this idea. Every year, lots of people try to climb the world's highest mountains or walk across whole continents. Explorers in the past used maps and compasses. But today's adventurers use modern technology like GPS and satellite phones. A lot of adventurers love nature. They use their trips to help people learn about environmental problems. Others want to help people who need it and collect money for charities.

The first thing is DART – the Double Asteroid Redirection Test. DART will be tested on the moon of an asteroid named Didymos. This moon, Didymoon, is 150 meters wide and moves around its 800-meter bigger asteroid. We hope the impact from DART will push Didymoon enough that telescopes on Earth can see it change its path.

The heroine of the story, a sixteen year old girl called Katniss Everdeen, has lost her father in a mining accident and has to provide food for her family. She hunts in the woods around District 12 with her friend Gale and becomes very skilful with a bow and arrow. When her younger sister, Prim, is chosen as one of the tributes, Katniss volunteers to go instead. The other tribute from District 12 is a boy named Peeta and Katniss soon finds herself in a complicated relationship with him.

When you write about your dreams, you will start to remember more details. Think about the people and places in your dream; they might add to its meaning. After one week, you will be surprised by how much you have written. Now you can link your dreams to what happens and how you feel in your daily life.

In the past, many bridges were made of wood, and they could easily catch fire. This was especially true for old train bridges. Sparks from the steel train wheels on the steel tracks could make the bridge burn down.

It's hard to know how street art will grow in the future, but some new things are starting to happen. Many street artists are young people who paint in their own city or neighborhood. But now, more and more street artists are traveling and working in different countries around the world. Other artists are using the internet to talk to each other and show photos of their work. Also, the art world is starting to see street art as a real form of art. We don't know what will happen to street art in the future, but we are sure that it will continue to be popular!

Suzanne Collines has always found news programmes of wars upsetting. When she was a child, her father was a pilot in the US Air Force and he fought in Vietnam. Her mother tried to protect her by not telling her what was happening in the war, but she still saw news programmes about the war and knew that her dad was there. It was a very frightening experience for her.

PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC) asked over 40,000 people, both young and older (born between 1983 and 1993), about their work. They asked about how they work, how they talk to others, how they get paid, how they grow in their jobs, and how they balance work and life. Another group, Deloitte, asked over 10,000 young people about their thoughts on good and bad things in the difficult world of work.

Erik Weihenmayer is an American adventurer. He enjoys many activities. He has ridden a bike through Morocco's deserts, kayaked through the Grand Canyon, and climbed Mount Everest. Amazingly, Erik has been blind since he was 13. Besides his adventures, he encourages people with disabilities to live active lives. He also takes groups of young blind people on climbing trips.

Online platforms give people a way to make money quickly. For example, busy parents used to not sell their children's old things at markets. But now, with online shops, parents can sell baby clothes their children don't wear anymore and expensive baby items they bought. This helps them get some money back.

Pi and Richard Parker spend 227 days in a lifeboat. They experience hunger, illness, and tiredness. They survive strong storms and the hot sun on the Pacific. Pi finds comfort in his three religions at times, but he also feels lonely and sad. Finally, the Mexican coast appears, and everything changes. To discover the ending, you must read the book yourself to find out what happens to Pi and Richard Parker once they reach land.

Chloe returned home from school. She made a coffee and carried it to her room. She had homework, but decided to do it later. She wanted to enjoy the peaceful hour before her parents got home. After they arrived, the house would become lively with conversation, TV sounds, or her dad playing his beloved jazz music while cooking dinner. She also liked this time because she could play with her pet rats.

In 2010, NASA’s team that defends the planet found most of the big rocks in space near Earth. These rocks are called "near-Earth objects" or NEOs. They are as big as mountains. They can be as close as 50 million kilometers to Earth. NASA still needs to find about 50 more of these rocks. But NASA says that the 887 rocks they know about are not a big threat to our planet.

Auggie decides to go to school. His first day is difficult. Like other children starting a new school, he feels very anxious. But because of his appearance, it is a very painful experience. No one wants to sit next to him, and he notices other children staring at him or talking about him quietly. Fortunately, he becomes friends with Jack, a boy in his class, and Summer, a girl he talks to at lunch. But it is not just the first day that is hard. Auggie soon learns that his classmates do not want to touch him because they are afraid of catching 'the plague'. As the school year progresses, Auggie experiences many intense ups and downs until an unexpected and sad event at a school camp completely changes things.

The two men looked at the north part of the land. It was very large, and they could not see the end of it. The fences were hard to see from where they stood. Even a bored and rebellious teenage boy could not walk away and escape. Sam looked at the largest horse, which was hitting the ground with its hooves. He wondered if the boy could ride a horse. A good rider could find a lot of trouble far away from anyone else. But maybe someone who knew nothing about horses and wanted to get away from his father would find even more trouble.

More than 4,000 climbers, from 13 to 80 years old, have successfully reached the summit of Everest. While climbing high mountains in icy conditions and severe storms remains highly perilous, the world's most accomplished climbers are now seeking new challenges. Gerlinde Kaltenbrunner from Austria developed a passion for mountain climbing as a teenager. After she completed her schooling, she worked as a nurse, but she continued to climb in her leisure time.

Gerlinde climbed Mount Everest. After that, she decided to climb all fourteen of the world's mountains that are 8,000 meters high. To make it more challenging, Gerlinde climbs without using oxygen tanks. This is risky because not enough oxygen at the top of high mountains can affect how her brain and body work. Gerlinde uses her fame as a climber to support a charity that helps poor children and orphans in Nepal.

If you look at the things we buy, you might see that we don't use everything well. For example, a warm coat in a hot country, an old phone after getting a new one, a car used only on weekends, or a guest room that became a storage room.

Throughout history, people have believed dreams can predict the future. They thought dreams were messages from gods, giving us knowledge or advice. Even now, many people remember dreaming about something – an event, place, or person – and then it happened in real life.

Building bridges is one of the biggest and most expensive transport projects in the world. Bridges are important links that carry cars, trucks and trains over water, mountains or other roads. So, they are a very important part of civil engineering. People check them very carefully, especially if they fall down.

Gabriela was frustrated for a long time. She emailed her manager in Sweden about problems with her team. Her manager asked if her team was still working well. He also asked what she thought would help her work better with them. Gabriela felt her manager was not clear. She did not think he was helping enough.

Dogs that live in groups have learned that people are more likely to give food to smaller, cuter dogs. So, these dogs go to ask for food for the whole group. Some dogs have even learned to use the city's subway system to travel from one part of their area to another! Scientists don't know how these dogs know when to get off the train. One idea is that they use their great sense of smell and have learned to know the smells of their favorite places. Another idea is that they have learned to know the names of stations they hear in announcements. People who ride the subway are now used to seeing dogs on the trains, so the dogs travel without many people noticing them.

Ed Stafford from the UK was the first person to walk the entire Amazon River. He began in the Andes mountains in Peru and finished at the river's end in Brazil. This journey took him two years and four months, covering 6,000 kilometers. The Amazon rainforest is full of dangerous animals like poisonous snakes, crocodiles, and jaguars, so Ed was always in danger. Fortunately, he survived with only many mosquito and ant bites.

In Britain, the average person spends over £1,000 on new clothes each year. This is about four percent of their money. This might not seem like a lot. But, this number hides two bigger problems for society and the environment. First, many people buy clothes with credit cards. British people currently owe about £670 per adult to credit card companies. This is 66 percent of what they spend on clothes. Also, people are spending money they don't have. They are buying things they don't need. Britain throws away 300,000 tons of clothes every year. Most of these clothes go into rubbish dumps.

Ed's walk would have been impossible without technology. He used a radio to ask the people of the rainforest for food and permission to cross their land. Many of them came to meet him and helped guide him through the most difficult terrain. As he walked, Ed wrote a blog, recording his day-to-day experiences. He used the media interest in his trip to protest about the destruction of the rainforest and raise money for environmental and children's charities in Brazil and Peru.

Businesses like how much money they can make from the sharing economy. They want to use things that are not used enough. A popular business model is when companies make a website or app. This lets customers find people who can give them a product or service. For example, Airbnb helps people rent out their extra rooms and houses for money. Another example is Uber. It lets people use their own cars as taxis to earn more money when they have free time.

Zoos are very important today because they help animals have babies, especially those that are in danger. In nature, some very rare animals have problems finding partners and having babies. Also, people who hunt illegally, losing their homes, and other animals can be a danger to them. A good zoo helps these animals live and have babies in a safe place. When there are fewer wild animals, there is a bigger risk that animals in a group will be too much alike. Having more babies in zoos helps with this. Animals born in zoos can go back into the wild to make the groups of animals more different.

Both types of accidents are rare. Ships and trains can make a bridge fall down for different reasons. Trains can hit a bridge hard and make it fall. Boats are very big and heavy. Even if they move slowly, they can make a bridge fall. To stop bridges from falling, we need to plan for it. New technology can find weak spots in bridges. Safer workplaces and better designs can help stop these bad accidents.

At first, Pi is terrified of the animals, so he jumps into the ocean. Then he remembers there are hungry sharks in the water, and he realizes he must climb back into the lifeboat. One by one, the animals in the lifeboat kill and eat each other until only Pi and the tiger are left. Luckily for Pi, the tiger, whom he names Richard Parker, is seasick and has no immediate interest in eating him.

When Pi is 16, a new government is chosen, and his parents are not happy about it. Because they are worried about what might happen, Pi's parents decide to shut down their zoo and move to Canada. They sell some of the animals to other zoos in North America, and the family travels by ship to Canada, bringing the rest of the animals with them. During the trip, a terrible storm hits, and the ship sinks. Sadly, Pi's family and the sailors on the ship all drown. However, Pi ends up in a lifeboat with a hyena, a zebra, an orangutan, and a huge tiger.

The Hunger Games is a very popular book for young people by Suzanne Collins. It has been translated into 26 languages and has sold millions of copies worldwide. It is also the first book for young readers to sell over a million e-books. The Hunger Games is now a major Hollywood film and is just as successful. It made 152.5 million dollars in its first weekend in North America.

Dreams might be our brain sorting our thoughts from the day. These thoughts appear as symbols in our dreams. When we are awake, we mostly think with words, like we are talking to ourselves. But when we are sleeping, the part of our brain that uses language becomes less active, and the part that controls feelings becomes more active.

Good relationships make you happy. A study found that most happy people have strong connections with friends and family, and they spend time together often. You also need to share your personal feelings with at least one person; this is called 'self-disclosure'. Just one person for a deep conversation is enough, in addition to other friends. It's not enough to only have many friends for activities or talking about light topics like music or sports. That deeper connection is very important. Some people need to learn how to listen well to others to build stronger relationships.

Carol Dweck, a psychologist, said that our brains can change. We can learn new skills and talents, even if we are not good at them at first. Many times, we tell people they are good at something because of their natural talent, like saying 'You are good at finding small things' or 'You are good at planning parties.' But studies show that if we praise the way people do things, like how much they try, how they try new things, and how they solve problems, we can help them learn new skills and get better at what they do.

The rover regularly checks the air. In 2014, it found methane in the air. Methane is a basic organic molecule and a part of natural gas. Methane only lasts for a few hundred years, which means something on Mars is making more of it. NASA says Mars releases thousands of tons of methane. The amount of methane changes with the seasons, almost as if the planet is breathing it.

When Carol Dweck, a smart person, worked with ten-year-old kids, she gave them hard puzzles. Some kids liked the puzzles and knew they could learn. She said they had a 'growth mindset.' These kids thought about what they could do later. But other kids felt bad because they thought the puzzles showed they were not good enough. They had a 'fixed mindset' and could not think about getting better. Some of these kids even said they might cheat next time. Others looked for kids who did worse to feel better about themselves.

Horror films often use empty places. These might be old hospitals, empty houses, or towns where no one lives. There's something interesting about lonely, empty places. What was it like when people lived there? Why did they go away? Perhaps it's also very quiet, which can be frightening. Also, these empty places are good for horror films because it's easier to believe you won't have phone service there.

Basements are scary places in horror movies. Something is usually hiding there, or a bad person has hidden their tools there. Basements are always dark and often wet. You can only get to them by a small staircase. And basements are always strange, even when nothing is there.

Gary Collins, a policeman not working at the time, was watching the London riots on TV. He knew some people right away and stopped his vacation early to help find out who they were. He spent six months looking at security camera videos and was able to identify 190 people, many just by their eyes. His help was very important for the investigation. Even with a lot of video (200,000 hours), computer programs that recognize faces only found one person.

I believe it's interesting to think about making our bodies better to help us evolve faster. Imagine putting a computer in your brain! Soon, we can do this. We will improve our math skills, how we see and hear, and our memory. This idea will become more common.

The talk was very good. The speaker said some very true things. For example, about parents. How can we expect teenagers not to text while doing their homework? Their parents text while cooking dinner or waiting at a red light. She also said it’s true that people want to be in many places at once. So they switch between talking in real life and talking online. I see this often with my teenage daughter and her friends. They meet, but then they sit together quietly while each one talks to different people online.

Even though news makes us feel the world is becoming more dangerous, there's also good news. From the end of World War II to 1990, 30 wars happened, and over 100,000 people died in each. Now, we still have civil wars, but most countries are getting along better than before. But, terrorism has increased a lot recently. Since World War II, more regular people have died in wars than soldiers. Still, for regular people, the numbers aren't all bad. Even though you are nine times more likely to die from violent crime than from war, the number of murders around the world went down a little. It went from 8 out of every 100,000 people in 2000 to about 5.3 in 2015.

Wasfia has spent her life helping people get their human rights. She has seen many international projects in her home country that teach and train women and girls. But often, when these projects end, the women and girls are left with nothing. Wasfia realized that Bangladesh needed to help itself. So, she combined two things she loved: climbing mountains and human rights. She wanted to change how people think about women in her country. She started climbing when she worked on projects in Tibet and Nepal. Most people in Bangladesh, which is a flat country near the sea, have never seen a mountain. Her plan seems to be working. People in her country and around the world are paying attention.

Many people think that developing countries are in a bad situation, suffering from extreme poverty and bad governments, with little chance of improvement. However, this idea is quite wrong. In reality, a significant change is happening. Over the past 20 years, more than 700 million people have improved their financial situation and are no longer poor. In addition, 6 million fewer children die each year from diseases, more girls are attending school, and many more people have access to clean water.

Managers sometimes give good comments before and after bad comments to make feedback seem more positive. But if this happens too often, employees might think the good comments are just to hide the bad ones, which makes the good comments less helpful. Instead, good comments should not just be used to make bad comments feel softer. They should be given to show what employees are doing well and to help them keep doing a good job.

I am part of a group called the Campaign to Stop Killer Robots. We are not talking about movie robots that look scary. We are talking about machines like drones and robots that are used in wars now. These machines can kill people with very little human control. Soon, there might be robots that can decide on their own who to kill. I think this is wrong and dangerous for people. We need to be careful about what we let machines do.

More people are learning English than all other languages combined, and English is spoken in the most countries. However, Chinese has the most native speakers. There seems to be little connection between how many native speakers a language has and the number of learners. But there is a stronger link between the number of learners and how many countries have speakers.

Your boss stops you and wants to talk about your work on the last project. You spend the weekend worrying, thinking about your mistakes. On Monday, in her office, she first praises your good work on the project. You wonder if this is just polite talk before bad news. You know the "feedback sandwich": nice words, then the real problem, then nice words again.

Born in the USA is a rock album with fast music. But its songs also have strong feelings. The happy rock music hides sad stories about the American dream. Many songs are about normal people who work hard. They are angry and sad because they don't get rich or famous. For example, "Glory Days" is about small-town people remembering their youth when they felt powerful. "Downbound Train" tells about a young man whose life is ruined after losing his job. It seems like the singer is writing about real people he knew. He might be thinking about the life he would have had if he wasn't a star. This album shows that the Boss is a very special and talented artist.

Lewis wants to make more parts of the ocean safe. Now, only 3 out of 100 parts are safe. He wants to make 10 out of 100 parts safe. This is to help fix problems caused by people, like catching too many fish, making the water dirty, and throwing trash. Lewis has seen these problems himself. He has swum over coral reefs that are now white because the water is too warm. He has also seen places in the Red Sea where there is no life, only plastic. Lewis thinks nature can get better if we give it a chance. But we need to hurry. If we don't start taking care of our oceans, we might have a problem we can't fix.

Terrie Sharp is an author who writes popular books. She has won the Olive Crime Writer Award two times. She was born in Glasgow, in an area with a lot of crime. She learned to be quiet and avoid problems. She also learned how to open car doors with a knife. Luckily, she only used this knowledge to write her books, and she is much more outgoing now. She appears on TV shows like Police Today and attends writing conferences around the UK.

Is life getting worse? Is it hard to make things better? In his book, Steven Pinker says that humans are doing well. We live for more years, are healthier, have more freedom, and are happier. Pinker says the real problem is that people are not using good ideas like thinking with logic and using science. When people listen to others who make them feel like they only care about their own group, or feel like there is no hope, or do not trust others, we can damage important things like democracy and countries working together.

In old scary movies, people needing help couldn't easily call for help or the police. Mobile phones make that less believable now. So, to keep movies exciting, there's no phone signal! If you're a hero in a scary movie, when you really need to call for help, you probably won't have any signal. Or your phone battery will die just when you're calling. Or both.

In the 1950s, banana farms in Central America had a problem. Their best banana, the Gros Michel, was dying. Now, the same thing is happening to the Cavendish banana, which took its place. The Gros Michel banana was easy to move, had a thick skin, and tasted sweet. It was grown a lot in Central America. United Fruit, a big banana company then, grew many bananas. They copied plants from stems instead of using seeds. They grew many plants together in fields.

Most spiders have venom. They use it to paralyze or kill the animals they hunt, not to attack people. Only 25 kinds of spiders have venom that can hurt humans. If a spider bites you, it might hurt, but it almost never kills you. The Sydney funnel-web spider in Australia hasn't killed anyone since 1981, because doctors made a special medicine for its venom. But be careful with hairy spiders like tarantulas. If they are scared, they can shoot out many small, itchy hairs. These hairs can get stuck in your skin or in your eyes.

This scary movie theme was very popular in horror films of the late 20th century. It starts with teenagers enjoying themselves. Then, everyone dies except one girl. At the beginning, the girl is usually innocent, shy, and not very strong. By the end, she has become the toughest and most resourceful person. The last girl almost always wins in the end.

If we want to understand how we got our ability to use complex language, we need to study how our brains are different from animal brains. It is not just about brain size. It is important to know what else our brains can do and when and why they changed this way. We don't have many physical clues for this. Things left by our ancestors don't tell us what kind of speech they could make. But we can see something in the remains of early humans: how their mouth, throat, and tongue developed. About 100,000 years ago, humans learned to make complex sounds. Before that, scientists can only guess if early humans used simpler sounds to communicate.

Society, not nature, tells us that girls should prefer arts and humanities, and boys should prefer math and physics. Also, young people do not see many good female role models in science jobs. Cartoons and stories often show male scientists, inventors, or astronauts. There is also a sad idea that scientists are odd, not good at talking to people, or that their work is lonely and not part of the rest of the world. These are wrong ideas from the media. They might make girls not feel like scientists, and think science is not a good career. If girls saw more good female role models in science, they would feel more confident and more like they belong in those subjects.

The Scallion is a weekly newspaper that students write and produce. It is free and given out in university buildings. Around 10,000 students read it. A survey shows that students and staff at the university really value the newspaper for entertainment, cultural learning, and work experience. Printing the newspaper is expensive. Also, some students find it hard to get a copy because they have to go to the university to pick it up. Another environmental problem is that many copies end up as trash on campus.

At Girox Foods, 12 out of 100 workers leave each year. This is more than the average of 7 out of 100 for other companies. This report will look into why employees are not happy at work. Then, it will suggest ways to make work better for employees so they stay longer at the company longer.

What the speaker said felt true to me. I believe there's a risk that as we become more connected, we might feel more alone. My generation, who lived without technology for a long time, doesn't have this problem as much. We know how to be alone, and that it's okay. But for people under 20, it's different. They are so busy talking that they don't experience being alone, and they might not learn to like their own company. Also, they learn to talk through messages that can be edited, instead of learning how to have real conversations with people in person.

Do not always give good feedback and then bad feedback. If good and bad feedback always go together, the good feedback might not seem important anymore. Make sure you sometimes give only good feedback, and try not to give criticism at the same time.
